The Amazon Rainforest, also known as Amazonia, is a moist broadleaf tropical rainforest in the Amazon biome that covers most of the Amazon basin of South America. This basin encompasses 7 million square kilometers, of which 5.5 million square kilometers are covered by the rainforest. This region includes territory belonging to nine nations and 3.4% of the world's total surface area. The majority of the forest is contained within Brazil, with 60% of the rainforest, followed by Peru with 13%, and with minor amounts in other countries. Based on this information, which country has the second largest portion of the Amazon Rainforest?
A. Colombia
B. Venezuela
C. Bolivia
D. Peru
